intro: Phyllanthus inflatus, commonly known as the inflated phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant features palmate leaves with lobes that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The fruit is a three-lobed capsule that splits open to release seeds.
